newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: INTERVIEW - Comalco NZ optimistic despite 1996 slump.
newsitem.headline: INTERVIEW - Comalco NZ optimistic despite 1996 slump.

text.p: Aluminium producer Comalco New Zealand said on Wednesday it was optimistic about the impact of a major smelter upgrade despite slumping to a NZ$13.5 million after-tax loss in 1996 from a 1995 profit of NZ$106.9 million.
Kerry McDonald, Managing Director of the Comalco Ltd controlled company, said the result reflected special circumstances including a slump in metal prices in 1996.
"The timing was unfortunate in terms of having a sharp reduction in metal price at a time when we were incurring higher costs through the commissioning of the upgrade," he told Reuters.
McDonald said he was unable to comment on profit forecasts because of stock exchange issues.
Comalco NZ spent NZ$464 million upgrading its Tiwai Point smelter which saw annual capacity increase to 313,000 tonnes from 270,000 tonnes.

"I'm optimistic about the impact of the upgrade. The project has gone well. It is a complex commissioning process because of the extent of the changes that we are making, and we are making a number of significant process changes at the same time... and I would say already that has proved to be a sound decision," McDonald said.
"It is delivering increased production already and it is showing every sign that it will have the desired impact to reduce costs and improve efficiencies," he said.
Comalco increased staff during the upgrade process but the company recently cut staff by 200.
McDonald said Comalco was driving very strongly to reduce costs in all aspects of the business.
"At the same time we are expecting operating efficiencies will continue to lift and improve to realise the benefits of the upgrade." -- Wellington newsroom 64 4 4734 746
